alert.note: Alert for Lewis (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 05 at 8:24AM PST until December 07 at 7:34PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Seattle WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington... Skagit River Near Mt. Vernon affecting Skagit County. Cowlitz River At Randle affecting Lewis County. Newaukum River Near Chehalis affecting Lewis County. .Heavy rain will continue in the Washington Cascades through this afternoon. Another 2 to 4 inches of rain is forecast before the rate rates ease late in the day. For the North West Region...including Mt. Vernon...Major flooding is forecast. For the South West Region...including Randle...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Chehalis River Basin Region...including Chehalis...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cowlitz River at Randle. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, the Cowlitz River will cause flooding from the vicinity of Randle downstream through Riffe Lake...inundating many roads including US Highway 12 and much of the farm lands. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM PST Tuesday the stage was 12.0 feet. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 21.5 feet late tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday morning. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.1 feet on 11/26/1999. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 445 PM PST.
